main event: On 24th May 1958 in San Diego, California, an oval-shaped object the size of a pen with red color was observed exhibiting very radical movement, coming from the West and moving into the North for approximately 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object's movement was described as very radical and it did not appear to match the expected behavior of a balloon, despite balloon schedules indicating a launch at the time of the sighting.
The observer, a reliable individual, seemed to have no idea about the nature of the observed object.
The sighting involved multiple witnesses, including a son who observed the object out of the window with his family.
The report mentions the lack of photographs but provides detailed information about the object's appearance, movement, and the surrounding conditions during the sighting.
The conclusion was marked as 'Unknown', suggesting a lack of sufficient data for evaluation and leaving the nature of the object unexplained.
witnesses: multiple witnesses including a reliable observer
photographs: no photographs provided in the report
